title: Domain 4.8: Explain appropriate incident response activities.
content:
🔁 Incident Response Process

  • 🧰 Preparation: Develop plans, tools, teams, and policies before an incident occurs.
  • 🔍 Detection: Identify potential security incidents through alerts, logs, or user reports.
  • 🧠 Analysis: Investigate the scope, impact, and origin of the incident.
  • 🛡️ Containment: Isolate affected systems to prevent the spread of the threat.
  • 🧹 Eradication: Remove the threat from all systems—malware, backdoors, compromised accounts.
  • 🔧 Recovery: Restore systems and services to normal operation with monitoring in place.
  • 📝 Lessons Learned: Conduct a post-incident review—what went well, what to improve?

🎓 Training

  • Ongoing education for employees and responders to recognize and respond to threats effectively.

🧪 Testing

  • 🧾 Tabletop Exercise: Discussion-based walk-through of an incident response plan—tests decision-making and coordination.
  • 🎮 Simulation: Realistic, hands-on incident scenario to test technical response and tools.

🧩 Root Cause Analysis

  • Identify the original source or vulnerability that led to the incident—helps prevent recurrence.

🧿 Threat Hunting

  • Proactively searching for hidden threats in the environment using hypothesis-driven investigation.

🕵️ Digital Forensics

  • 📂 Legal Hold: Preserve data for legal review—ensures evidence isn’t altered or destroyed.
  • 🔗 Chain of Custody: Track who accessed evidence and when—critical for legal integrity.
  • 📥 Acquisition: Safely collect evidence from systems, memory, storage, and networks.
  • 📄 Reporting: Create detailed, clear documentation of findings and actions taken.
  • 🧊 Preservation: Protect original evidence—create forensic copies and store securely.
  • 🧾 E-discovery: Search and retrieve digital evidence relevant to investigations or legal cases.
